greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = n + k, 0 <= k < n.
comment: all numbers m occur ceiling(m/2) times, see A004526.
The LCM of the n-th row is A076100. - _Michel Marcus_, Mar 18 2018
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..150 of triangle, flattened
Bruno Berselli, Illustration of the initial terms.
László Németh, On the Binomial Interpolated Triangles, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 20 (2017), Article 17.7.8.
Boris Putievskiy, Transformations [of] Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions, arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO], 2012.
formula: As a sequence rather than as a table: If m = floor((sqrt(8n-7)+1)/2), a(n) = n - m(m-3)/2 - 1. - _Carl R. White_, Jul 30 2009
T(m,n) = m+n-1, m >= n >= 1. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 23 2009 [corrected by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Nov 23 2009]
mathematica: Table[n + Range[0, n - 1], {n, 12}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 16 2016 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 24 2004
